intro: Cochlearia saxatilis f. pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf rock scurfpea, is a low-growing, herbaceous plant native to coastal regions of Europe. It is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant thrives in rocky, saline soils and is often found in coastal cliffs and dunes. Its compact form and ability to tolerate harsh maritime conditions make it a resilient species. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, sharing characteristics with other members of the mustard family.
